Claim: A video claims to show an Eid prayer in China in December 2019.
Explaination: This is a prayer in China in June 19, not related to Cov.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video claims to show an Eid prayer in China in December 2019.

Explanation:This is a prayer in China in June 19, not related to Cov.

http://u.afp.com/EidPrayer

Claim: CDC recommends that people shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.
Explaination: No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.
Label: False
html:
Claim: CDC recommends that people shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.

Explanation:No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/no-us-health-body-has-not-recommended-shaving-facial-hair-prevent-coronavirus-1660754-2020-03-28

Claim: Says businesses will give you free baby formula during the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: Several formula producers have released statements saying the rumor is a hoax.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: Says businesses will give you free baby formula during the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:Several formula producers have released statements saying the rumor is a hoax.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/23/facebook-posts/no-companies-arent-giving-out-free-baby-formula-du/

Claim: Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “was in charge of the H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic which killed thousands of people. The response was one of the worst on record. Our response is one of the best, with fast action of border closings and a 78% approval rating, the highest on record. His was lowest!”
Explaination: Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Donald Trump claims Joe Biden “was in charge of the H1N1 Swine Flu epidemic which killed thousands of people. The response was one of the worst on record. Our response is one of the best, with fast action of border closings and a 78% approval rating, the highest on record. His was lowest!”

Explanation:Joe Biden was not in charge of the Obama administration’s H1N1 response. Trump overstated public confidence in his administration’s response to the coronavirus and downplayed confidence in the Obama administration’s response to H1N1.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/15/donald-trump/fact-checking-trumps-attacks-obama-biden-swine-flu/

Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.
Explaination: The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: An image with human body figurines in a bowl that claims China is serving human baby soup in its restaurants.

Explanation:The image is of an art installation to raise awareness about the rampant killing of sharks.

https://www.boomlive.in/fake-news/2015-photo-falsely-shared-as-amit-shah-visiting-covid-19-patients-7380

Claim: A video on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus.
Explaination: But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video on Facebook and YouTube purports to show billionaire businessman Jack Ma praising China’s response to the outbreak of the novel coronavirus.

Explanation:But the video has been doctored; the original video shows Jack Ma at a meeting of former Alibaba employees in 2018, at least one year before COVID-19 was first detected in the Chinese city of Wuhan; the voiceover in the clip has been taken from another clip which shows a different man speaking.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-has-been-doctored-it-does-not-feature-voice-chinese-businessman-jack-ma

Claim: The U.S. presidential election is canceled due to coronavirus.
Explaination: The federal government has made no such announcement about canceling the U.S. presidential election.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The U.S. presidential election is canceled due to coronavirus.

Explanation:The federal government has made no such announcement about canceling the U.S. presidential election.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471893-fact-check-us-election-is-not-canceled-due-to-coronavirus.html

Claim: A Facebook post shared 25,000 times features an image of a letter purportedly from a U.S. hospital recommending people drink alcohol to help reduce the risks of novel coronavirus infection.
Explaination: Saint Luke’s Hospital in Kansas City did not issue the letter, according to its staff.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Facebook post shared 25,000 times features an image of a letter purportedly from a U.S. hospital recommending people drink alcohol to help reduce the risks of novel coronavirus infection.

Explanation:Saint Luke’s Hospital in Kansas City did not issue the letter, according to its staff.

https://factcheck.afp.com/fake-us-hospital-letter-says-alcohol-reduces-covid-19-risks

Claim: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.
Explaination: The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but it was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Journalist claims a coronavirus patient was murdered.

Explanation:The tweet did go out from a TV reporter, but it was doctored to claim that a murder investigation was underway at the nursing home.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471805-Fact-Check-A-Journalist-Did-NOT-Claim-A-Coronavirus-Patient-Was-Murdered.html

Claim: Cocaine kills the coronavirus.
Explaination: Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. Previously busted claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cocaine kills the coronavirus.

Explanation:Fake story was generated by a website that allows people to create their own news stories. Previously busted claim.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471765-fact-check-scientists-did-not-discover-that-cocaine-kills-coronavirus.html

Claim: Ugandan landlords have been asked by the government to stop collecting rent as citizens stay home to fight COVID-19.
Explaination: A letter allegedly from State House Uganda directing landlords in the country to stop collecting rent as Ugandans stay home to fight COVID-19 is not authentic.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ugandan landlords have been asked by the government to stop collecting rent as citizens stay home to fight COVID-19.

Explanation:A letter allegedly from State House Uganda directing landlords in the country to stop collecting rent as Ugandans stay home to fight COVID-19 is not authentic.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-letter-directing-ugandan-landlords-to-stop-collecting-rent-due-to-covid-19-is-not-8b8637e6dc84?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: A video claims to show a plane carrying medical supplies to China.
Explaination: This video shows a plane in Kenya carrying humanitarian aid bound for China.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: A video claims to show a plane carrying medical supplies to China.

Explanation:This video shows a plane in Kenya carrying humanitarian aid bound for China.

http://u.afp.com/kenyaaidplane

Claim: Leave objects in the sun to avoid contracting the coronavirus.
Explaination: There’s no evidence that sunlight can kill the coronavirus. Experts say ultraviolet light in the sun isn't strong enough.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Leave objects in the sun to avoid contracting the coronavirus.

Explanation:There’s no evidence that sunlight can kill the coronavirus. Experts say ultraviolet light in the sun isn't strong enough.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/27/facebook-posts/still-no-proof-sunlight-kills-new-coronavirus/

Claim: Saline solutions can kill the new coronavirus.
Explaination: Doctor and WHO deny this claim.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Saline solutions can kill the new coronavirus.

Explanation:Doctor and WHO deny this claim.

http://u.afp.com/349U

Claim: Ecuadorian government gives money to people from Venezuela.
Explaination: The government doesn't give money to Venezuelans.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Ecuadorian government gives money to people from Venezuela.

Explanation:The government doesn't give money to Venezuelans.

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/?fbclid=IwAR1LPZVARe1YjPhq3jijxwuSjIPKxv_9Io6BRDHJ2Cx45oaFHlhnm2_y5ZI?check=10

Claim: Uganda did not deport 19 passengers from high-risk COVID-19 countries.
Explaination: Ugandan authorities did not deport 19 passengers on a KLM flight from Amsterdam to Entebbe. The passengers did not show 'severe' flu-like symptoms.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Uganda did not deport 19 passengers from high-risk COVID-19 countries.

Explanation:Ugandan authorities did not deport 19 passengers on a KLM flight from Amsterdam to Entebbe. The passengers did not show 'severe' flu-like symptoms.

https://pesacheck.org/false-uganda-did-not-deport-19-passengers-from-high-risk-covid-19-countries-99015b151a91

Claim: People in Italy have thrown all of their money on the roads outside saying that this money is useless to save them from death.
Explaination: The images doing rounds on social media are not from Italy but from Venezuela when the country was facing economic collapse in 2018.
Label: False
html:
Claim: People in Italy have thrown all of their money on the roads outside saying that this money is useless to save them from death.

Explanation:The images doing rounds on social media are not from Italy but from Venezuela when the country was facing economic collapse in 2018.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15460595

Claim: The Social Security System (SSS) in the Philippines “approved financial aid worth P20,000 for every member,” to assist those affected by the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Social Security System (SSS) in the Philippines “approved financial aid worth P20,000 for every member,” to assist those affected by the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The SSS has not announced such financial aid for every member. On its official Facebook page, the SSS denied the claim, saying it was "fake news."

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/255672-sss-approves-aid-every-member-coronavirus

Claim: The Brazilian singer Preta Gil was infected with COVID-19 and performed to more than 320,000 people.
Explaination: When the singer performed to 320 thousand people, on March 1, she was not infected with the new coronavirus. She started feeling ill on March 11 and tested positive on March 13. Since then, she has been in quarantine.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The Brazilian singer Preta Gil was infected with COVID-19 and performed to more than 320,000 people.

Explanation:When the singer performed to 320 thousand people, on March 1, she was not infected with the new coronavirus. She started feeling ill on March 11 and tested positive on March 13. Since then, she has been in quarantine.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-cantora-brasileira-infetada-com-o-novo-coronavirus-atuou-para-300-mil-pessoas/

Claim: The white side of a surgical mask should be worn on the outside, with the colored side on the inside.
Explaination: Only the coloured side of the surgical mask is to be worn outside and N95 masks are better than these normal surgical masks.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: The white side of a surgical mask should be worn on the outside, with the colored side on the inside.

Explanation:Only the coloured side of the surgical mask is to be worn outside and N95 masks are better than these normal surgical masks.

https://www.boomlive.in/health/is-there-a-right-way-to-wear-a-surgical-mask-a-factcheck-6750

Claim: “Cocaine kills coronavirus, scientists are shocked to discover that this drug can fight the virus.”
Explaination: This “breaking news” image is from an online news generator and not based on any real news coverage.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Cocaine kills coronavirus, scientists are shocked to discover that this drug can fight the virus.”

Explanation:This “breaking news” image is from an online news generator and not based on any real news coverage.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/feb/11/facebook-posts/cocaine-not-shown-treat-novel-coronavirus/

Claim: Countries that are the most affected by the coronavirus are along the same latitude.
Explaination:
1. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored.
2. Further, all of the aforementioned cities and countries are not situated along Latitude 40 degrees.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Countries that are the most affected by the coronavirus are along the same latitude.

Explanation:1. The fact that large countries cannot be represented by a single latitude is conveniently ignored. 2. Further, all of the aforementioned cities and countries are not situated along Latitude 40 degrees.

https://www.thequint.com/news/webqoof/places-most-affected-by-covid-19-situated-at-latitude-40-degrees-fake-news-fact-check

Claim: Local hospital in Ecuador says first covid patient didn’t have coronavirus.
Explaination: Please click the link to read the full article
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: Local hospital in Ecuador says first covid patient didn’t have coronavirus.

Explanation:Please click the link to read the full article

http://www.ecuadorchequea.com/las-mentiras-sobre-el-covid-19-en-ecuador/

Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.
Explaination: The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A claim has been shared on Facebook and several Sri Lankan news websites that Muslims at a mosque in Sri Lanka reacted violently after authorities told them their gathering was in violation of the country’s novel coronavirus curfew.

Explanation:The claim is misleading; police and public health officials said that locals were in fact asked to gather at the mosque to receive tests to detect COVID-19, the disease caused by the novel coronavirus. The scuffle that occurred at the event was sparked over fears that the testing site would make the village more susceptible to infections, they said.

https://factcheck.afp.com/misleading-claim-circulates-muslims-ignored-covid-19-curfew-sri-lankan-mosque

Claim: The 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) is a “type of rabies” that can be contracted by eating bats.
Explaination: In a press briefing on Tuesday, January 28, Health Secretary Francisco Duque III clarified that the 2019 nCoV belongs to the Coronaviridae family of viruses. Meanwhile, rabies is from Rhabdoviridae.
Label: False
html:
Claim: The 2019 novel coronavirus (nCoV) is a “type of rabies” that can be contracted by eating bats.

Explanation:In a press briefing on Tuesday, January 28, Health Secretary Francisco Duque III clarified that the 2019 nCoV belongs to the Coronaviridae family of viruses. Meanwhile, rabies is from Rhabdoviridae.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/250431-novel-coronavirus-type-rabies
